description: Borrowed from French hippodrome, from Latin hippodromos, from Ancient Greek ἱππόδρομος (hippódromos), from ἵππος (híppos, “horse”) + δρόμος (drómos, “course”); synchronically, hippo- +‎ -drome.

entries.meaning: (US, slang, sports) A fraudulent sporting contest with a predetermined winner.

verbs.description: hippodrome (third-person singular simple present hippodromes, present participle hippodroming, simple past and past participle hippodromed)

entries.meaning: (US, slang, sports, especially baseball) To stage a sporting contest to suit gamblers.
